title: Sinclair to Air "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" Again, Nexstar Holds Out
snippets: Broadcast station owner Sinclair will begin airing "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" after three days of preempting the program since its return.

Announcement leaves Nexstar as the only TV station owner still preempting the late-night talkshow

Local TV conglomerate Sinclair Broadcast Group said its ABC-affiliate stations will start airing Jimmy Kimmy Live! again on Friday night, ending its preempting of the show.

Sinclair, alon
The Sinclair suspension of Jimmy Kimmel’s late-night show prevented it from airing in Washington, D.C., Seattle and other popular markets.
Sinclair agreed to air "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" on its ABC stations again. Rival broadcaster Nexstar still hasn't brought back Kimmel's show.

Sinclair Broadcasting will air Jimmy Kimmel’s late-night talk show on its 38 ABC affiliate stations once again, the company announced, after Disney reinstated Kimmel from a suspension earlier this week. Along with fellow broadcast company Nexstar, Sinclair had suspended airing Kimmel’s show under pr

Local-television giant Sinclair Inc. said Friday that it was ending its boycott of late-night host Jimmy Kimmel’s program on the company’s ABC affiliates, leaving Nexstar Media Group Inc. as the last remaining holdout.
titles: Sinclair-owned ABC stations will bring 'Jimmy Kimmel Live' back to air Friday
Sinclair ends boycott of Jimmy Kimmel Live! and will bring show back on air
Sinclair’s 38 Stations Will Air ‘Jimmy Kimmel Live!’ After Boycott After Charlie Kirk Monologue
Sinclair agrees to bring back 'Jimmy Kimmel Live!' to its ABC stations
TV giant Sinclair is putting Jimmy Kimmel back on the air
Sinclair ends boycott of Jimmy Kimmel show, putting pressure on Nexstar to bring program back
summary: Sinclair Broadcast Group will resume airing "Jimmy Kimmel Live!" on its 38 ABC affiliate stations after a three-day suspension, leaving Nexstar as the only broadcaster still not airing the show. This decision follows Disney's reinstatement of Kimmel earlier in the week. Sinclair's suspension had affected major markets including Washington, D.C., and Seattle.

title: NYC Shooter Had Early-Stage CTE, Medical Examiner Confirms
snippets: The New York City chief medical examiner confirmed Tamura had low-stage CTE

The 27-year-old gunman who shot and killed four people, and then himself, on July 28 in the New York City high-rise that includes the NFL office had CTE, a medical examiner said Friday, according to an NBC News report.
A medical examiner confirmed Friday that Shane Tamura, who killed four people in July and blamed the NFL for hiding the dangers of brain injuries was suffering from CTE.
The midtown Manhattan office shooter, Shane Tamura, left behind a note saying "study brain for CTE."
Shane Tamura showed evidence of early-stage degenerative brain disease tied to repeated blows to the head, according to New York City’s chief medical examiner.
titles: Shane Tamura, gunman who targeted NFL headquarters, had CTE, medical examiner says
NYC shooter Shane Tamura, who targeted NFL office, had CTE, medical examiner says: Report
Gunman who killed 4 at NFL offices had CTE, says medical examiner
NYC office shooter who criticized NFL had CTE in his brain, medical examiner says
NFL office shooter had low-level CTE, NYC medical examiner finds
summary: Shane Tamura, the 27-year-old who killed four people and himself in a New York City high-rise on July 28, was confirmed by the chief medical examiner to have early-stage CTE. Tamura left a note urging his brain be studied for the condition, often linked to repeated head trauma. This finding was reported after he blamed the NFL for concealing the risks of brain injuries.

title: Chiefs' Fastest Receiver Worthy Returns for Ravens Game After Injury
snippets: Xavier Worthy, the Chiefs' fastest receiver, is expected to play in Sunday's game against the Ravens after missing the past two games with a shoulder injury.
Worthy has missed the Chiefs' last two games with a shoulder injury
Kansas City's speedy second-year wide receiver has missed multiple games with a shoulder injury. Here's the latest on his status for Week 4.
The Kansas City Chiefs will get an ejection of energy for a big game in Week 4.

Chiefs’ Xavier Worthy expected to play vs. Ravens
summary: Xavier Worthy, the Kansas City Chiefs' fastest receiver, is set to return for Sunday's game against the Ravens after missing two games due to a shoulder injury. His comeback is expected to boost the team's performance in Week 4.

title: Netanyahu Vows to Continue Hamas War Amid Global Criticism at UN
snippets: The Israeli prime minister's speech was defiant, despite his growing international isolation over his refusal to end the devastating war to eradicate Hamas.
The Israeli leader rails against critics and denounces Western allies for recognising Palestine in fiery UN address.

Israeli prime minister said recognition of Palestinian state is ‘insane’ days after countries such as UK and France did so

  • Israeli loudspeakers broadcast Netanyahu’s sp

UNITED NATIONS (AP) — Encircled by critics and protesters at the United Nations, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu told fellow world leaders on Friday that his nation “must finish the job” against Hamas in Gaza, giving a defiant speech despite growing international isolation over his refusal
titles: At U.N., amid jeers and cheers, Netanyahu says Israel 'must finish the job' in Gaza
As delegates walk out, Netanyahu tells UN Israel must ‘finish job’ in Gaza
Netanyahu vows to ‘finish job’ in Gaza during UN speech as delegates walk out
Facing global isolation at UN, a defiant Netanyahu says Israel ‘must finish the job’ against Hamas
summary: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu delivered a defiant speech at the United Nations, insisting on continuing the war against Hamas despite international isolation and criticism, including from Western allies who have recognized Palestinian statehood. His remarks followed actions by countries like the UK and France in recognizing Palestine, which led to protests and walkouts during his address. Netanyahu's stance has drawn accusations of war crimes and increased pressure to end the conflict, amidst reports of Palestinians living in poverty.

title: Fugitive Assata Shakur Dies in Cuba at 78
snippets: The fugitive revolutionary spent decades in exile after escaping from a US jail in 1979.
Assata Shakur had lived in exile in Cuba since 1979, after escaping a prison sentence for killing a police officer.

Shakur spent decades exiled after she was convicted of killing a state trooper in 1977 and escaped from prison

On 25 September, Assata Shakur, a former member of the Black Liberation Army, died aged 78 in Havana, Cuba, according to
Public Enemy's 1988 song “Rebel Without a Pause" includes the lyrics “supporter of Chesimard,” referring to the legal name of the longtime FBI Most Wanted.
titles: Assata Shakur, US Black liberation activist exiled in Cuba, dies at 78
Assata Shakur: Fugitive Black activist dies in exile in Cuba
Assata Shakur, an icon of Black liberation who was exiled to Cuba, dies aged 78
Assata Shakur, fugitive Black militant and godmother to Tupac, dies in Cuba
summary: Assata Shakur, a fugitive and former member of the Black Liberation Army who was convicted of killing a state trooper in 1977 and escaped from a US jail in 1979, has died at the age of 78 in Havana, Cuba. Shakur, also known by her legal name Chesimard and mentioned in Public Enemy's 1988 song "Rebel Without a Pause," spent decades in exile after fleeing to Cuba.

title: Ex-FBI Director Comey Indicted for False Statements, Obstruction
snippets: Ex-FBI Director James Comey indicted on criminal charges after Trump pressured the DOJ to investigate. And, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth calls unusual meeting of top military commanders.
Former FBI director James Comey indicted
Read: Former FBI chief Comey indicted on two charges&
The former FBI director has been indicted on charges of making a false statement and obstruction related to his testimony before the Senate Judiciary Committee in 2020.
President Donald Trump gloated about the filing of criminal charges against James Comey, whom he fired as FBI director in 2017, in his first White House term.
titles: Ex-FBI Director Comey has been indicted. And, Hegseth summons military leaders
Former FBI director James Comey indicted - Axios
Read: Former FBI chief Comey indicted on two charges - Axios
WATCH:  Former FBI Director James Comey reacts to indictment
Former FBI Director James Comey indicted after Trump called for charges
summary: Former FBI Director James Comey has been indicted by a federal grand jury on charges of making false statements and obstruction of justice. These charges are connected to his actions while investigating the Trump 2016 presidential campaign's potential collusion with Russia. President Donald Trump, who fired Comey in 2017, publicly expressed satisfaction over the indictment. The current status is that Comey faces legal proceedings for the accusations against him.

title: UN Delegates Walk Out During Netanyahu's Speech, Canada's Rae Stays Seated
snippets: Officials and diplomats left the auditorium in protest as the Israeli leader took the stage, leaving large parts of the hall empty.
Israel's prime minister said it would be "madness" for Israel to allow a Palestinian state to be established. Many delegates left the room before Benjamin Netanyahu began his speech. DW has more.
Netanyahu faces mass walk-out protest at UN speech
A Palestinian state would be “national suicide” for Israel, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said, but many of the diplomats and leaders at the assembly boycotted his remarks.
titles: Netanyahu attacks Palestinian recognition as dozens walk out of UN speech
UNGA: Netanyahu rejects Palestinian state in fiery speech
Netanyahu faces mass walk-out protest at UN speech - Axios
Defiant Netanyahu Denounces Palestine Recognition, to a Mostly Empty U.N. Hall
summary: During Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's speech at the UN General Assembly, a significant number of UN delegates walked out in protest. However, Canada's Ambassador Bob Rae did not participate in the walkout and remained seated throughout Netanyahu's address.

title: Canadian Postal Workers Strike Over Government's Cost-Cutting Measures
snippets:
Union says it’s ‘outraged and appalled’ by government’s order of sweeping changes to the national service

Postal workers in Canada have gone on strike after the government warned of an “existential crisis” and ordered sweeping changes t
Canada Post is on pace to lose $1 billion this year, officials say. The Canadian Union of Postal Workers says it was blindsided by cost-cutting measures.
The government’s previous attempts at postal service cuts were politically unpopular, but Canada Post’s dire financial situation has expedited them.
titles: Canada postal workers strike after government orders end to door-to-door delivery
Canada Post to end home delivery; workers declare national strike
Canada Orders Postal Service to End Door-to-Door Mail Delivery
summary: Postal workers in Canada have gone on strike following the government's announcement of major changes to the national postal service, citing an "existential crisis." The Canadian Union of Postal Workers expressed shock and outrage at the cost-cutting measures introduced in response to Canada Post's projected $1 billion loss this year. Previous efforts to reduce postal service costs were unpopular, but the current financial challenges have made such measures more urgent.

title: Hackers Threaten to Leak Data of Nursery Children and Staff at Kido Internationa
snippets: The criminals say they will share 30 more profiles along with 100 employees' data if a ransom is not paid.

Criminals calling themselves Radiant say they will post additional private data online unless they are paid

Hackers with pictures and the private information of thousands of nursery children have threatened to publish more information online unless they are paid.

Criminals calling the
Kido International, which runs nursery schools, reported the incident to the authorities after hackers posted sensitive data on the dark web and demanded a ransom.
titles: Nursery hackers threaten to publish more children's profiles online
Kido nursery hackers threaten to publish more children’s profiles
Hackers Steal Children’s Data and Photos from U.K. Nursery Chain
summary: Hackers, identifying as Radiant, have threatened to release private data of thousands of nursery children and 100 employees from Kido International unless a ransom is paid. The group has already posted sensitive information on the dark web. Kido International has reported the incident to the authorities.

Chief magistrate at Woolwich crown court rules that charge brought against musician is unlawful and ‘null’

A terrorism charge against the Kneecap rapper Liam Óg Ó hAnnaidh has been thrown out by the chief magistrate due to a technical error.

Ó hAnnaidh had been charged with a terroris

Terrorism case against Kneecap rapper Liam Óg Ó hAnnaidh thrown out
summary: The terrorism charges against Kneecap rapper Liam Óg Ó hAnnaidh were dismissed by the chief magistrate at Woolwich Crown Court due to a technical error in the filing process, rendering the charge unlawful and 'null'.

title: Canadiens' Reinbacher Out for 4 Weeks with Fractured Hand Bone
snippets: The team said Reinbacher has a fractured metacarpal bone, one of the five long bones forming the palm of the hand.
Defenceman David Reinbacher is out four weeks after sustaining a broken hand, the Montreal Canadiens announced on Friday.
titles: Canadiens defenceman Reinbacher out four weeks with broken hand
Canadiens’ David Reinbacher out four weeks with broken hand
summary: Montreal Canadiens' defenceman David Reinbacher will be sidelined for four weeks due to a fractured metacarpal bone in his hand. The team confirmed the injury, which is one of the five long bones in the palm.

General assembly backs new targets on cancer, diabetes and heart disease but Robert F Kennedy Jr objects

A new vision for tackling the global noncommunicable diseases (NCDs) crisis has failed to reach consensus at the UN after the
titles: RFK Jr. 'rejects' a U.N. declaration on non-communicable diseases
US refuses to back UN declaration on noncommunicable diseases
summary: Global health leaders were disappointed by Robert F. Kennedy Jr.'s opposition to a UN plan aimed at addressing noncommunicable diseases (NCDs) like cancer, diabetes, and heart disease. Despite his objection, the general assembly supported new targets for tackling these illnesses. The initiative will proceed without unanimous consensus.

title: EU to Build Drone Wall on East Border, Backs €140bn Ukraine Loan
snippets: Announcement comes after European bloc blamed Russia for violating Polish airspace in drone incursion this month.

Ministers aim to bolster defences after spate of airspace violations, amid rising momentum for €140bn loan to Ukraine

The EU has agreed to move forward with plans for a drone wall at the heart of its eastern defences as momentum grows for a €140bn loan to Ukraine based on Russian frozen ass
titles: EU to develop ‘drone wall’ amid regional airspace violations
EU to move forward with plans for drone wall amid Russian incursions
summary: The EU plans to establish a drone wall to strengthen its eastern defenses following a series of airspace violations, including a recent one blamed on Russia in Polish airspace. This decision coincides with growing support for a €140bn loan to Ukraine, funded by frozen Russian assets.

Donald Trump has said he will not allow Israel to annex the occupied West Bank, rejecting calls from some far-right polit
After more countries recognized a Palestinian state this week, President Trump said on Thursday that he would not permit Israel to take over the territory.
titles: Trump says he won't let Netanyahu annex the West Bank - Axios
Trump says he ‘will not allow’ Israel to annex West Bank after lobbying from allies
Trump Says He Won’t Allow Israel to Annex the West Bank
summary: US President Donald Trump announced he will not allow the annexation of the West Bank by Israel, despite several Israeli ministers advocating for it. This statement follows the recognition of a Palestinian state by more countries.

Mayfield said the Bucs' win over the Jets was 'personal' because of his history with Wilks
titles: Wilks jabs Baker back for 'cut me in Carolina' take
Steve Wilks jabs at Baker Mayfield after 'cut me in Carolina' comment: 'I don't think an interim has much say'
summary: Jets Defensive Coordinator Steve Wilks responded to Baker Mayfield's postgame comments, which highlighted the Buccaneers' win over the Jets as 'personal' due to Mayfield being cut by Wilks in Carolina. Wilks took five days to reply to Mayfield's jab, aiming to address the situation directly.

summary: Elon Musk, along with Peter Thiel and Steve Bannon, were named in a document related to a scheduled event on an island on December 6. However, Musk, the Tesla executive, has previously stated that he declined invitations to such events.

title: Electrons Travel Underground, Linking Chemical Zones for Ecosystem Health
snippets: Electrons flow underground in ways far more extensive than once believed, forming networks that link distant chemical zones. Minerals, organic molecules, and specialized bacteria can act as bridges, creating long-distance electron highways. These discoveries hold promise for pollution cleanup strate
Beneath our feet, an invisible world of electron exchanges quietly drives the chemistry that sustains ecosystems, controls water quality, and even determines the fate of pollutants.
titles: Hidden “electron highways” beneath our feet could revolutionize pollution cleanup
Study reveals hidden 'electron highways' that power underground chemistry and pollution cleanup
summary: Researchers have discovered that electrons can travel underground over long distances, connecting separate chemical zones through networks formed by minerals, organic molecules, and bacteria. This process, crucial for ecosystem sustainability, water quality, and pollutant degradation, suggests new methods for environmental cleanup.

title: Amazon Settles for $2.5B Over Prime Subscription Deception Claims
snippets: <a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMihgFBVV95cUxOVHZfNFRhbnRJcUdkQUViQWlta041LWJOYVpnYjA1SUlhMU5yNVFaRl9tR09sSTkxXzZ3S1JqeGVkZlA5Y2tnTzVXZFdpNnFPV01iaFBEV1B2Vms2Smd1YUhjX085a3F1QVljQ0o5eGdrakt0cUJjQlFMMGNiYkk3bzBXdW1YUQ?oc=5" target="_blank">How to get a refund from the Amazon Prime FTC
Amazon reaches $2.5 billion settlement over FTC's Prime lawsuit
Amazon's $2.5 billion settlement with the FTC over alleged unfair Prime signup and cancellation practices has important implications for every subscription marketer.
titles: How to get a refund from the Amazon Prime FTC settlement - Axios
Amazon reaches $2.5 billion settlement over FTC's Prime lawsuit - Axios
Amazon’s $2.5 Billion FTC Settlement Rattles Subscription Marketers
summary: Amazon has agreed to a $2.5 billion settlement with federal regulators over allegations of deceptive web designs that tricked millions into unwanted Prime subscriptions and made cancellation difficult. The settlement includes a $1 billion civil penalty and $1.5 billion in consumer refunds for the estimated 35 million affected. The FTC accused Amazon of using "dark patterns" for auto-renewals and a complex cancellation process. This resolution follows a lawsuit and a Business Insider investigation into Amazon Prime's practices.

summary: The 2025-2026 DWU High School and Middle School Challenges focus on engineering and aviation, respectively. The theme for the Middle School Aviation Challenge is "AgAir: Integrating UAS into the Agriculture Industry," highlighting the significance of uncrewed aircraft systems (UAS) in agriculture for food, fuel, and economic development. Participants are encouraged to explore the impact of UAS technology in the agricultural sector.

title: New Studies Shed Light on Bigscale Pomfret and Gaslighting Mechanisms
titles: What Is the Bigscale Pomfret? Scientists Unravel Secrets of an Oceanic Enigma
Scientists Unravel Secrets of How Gaslighting Really Works
summary: Scientists have conducted studies on the Bigscale Pomfret, revealing new insights into this oceanic species. In separate research, experts have also uncovered the mechanisms behind gaslighting, offering a deeper understanding of this psychological manipulation technique. Both studies contribute to our knowledge of marine biology and human behavior, respectively.
